page.title: 11TRENT VALLEY, BURSTON AREA
page.content:
The Trent Valley is wide in this area. The flood plain, known locally as "The Washlands" is unsuitable for building; these meadows are used for grazing.
The main road follows the valley, but keeps to the higher ground to the east. Both the Trent & Mersey Canal and the railway have also been constructed along the river valley between the river and the road, so the valley has thus developed as a focus for transport.
Access between the two sides of the valley is restricted to bridges. There is only one footbridge crossing the Trent in this area. The nearest road bridge is just west of Sandon.
